article:
'Accord and satisfaction' is a contract law concept about the purchase of the
release from a debt obligation. The payment is typically less than what is owed
and is not paid by the actual performance of the original obligation. The accord
is the agreement to discharge the obligation and the satisfaction is the legal
"consideration" which binds the parties to the agreement.

If a person is sued over an alleged debt, that person bears the burden of
proving the affirmative defense of accord and satisfaction.
